add compromise concept?
[[History/Background]]  [[021 Interview]]
Weekend Plans?
Nothing planned, and this is amazing. [[Code: Response-Socializing / relaxing]] And when you have nothing planned you have the whole day for yourself. That feels good. Maybe I'll watch a movie, maybe I'll go to nature with friends. Not do anything. When you have a full schedule for 5 days, six days a week. You get one day, which is sunday. You think, I can relax, I can finally have a free day without the calendar telling me to do this or to do that. I work two jobs, I work more than 12 hours a day. [[Code: Response-Overworking]]I am trying to go back to a normal life and one job and go back to 10 hours a day.
Why do you have two jobs?
(Name of startup) - first. And then since it's been really difficult in Lebanon I found an online jobto have it as extra. [[Code: Financial]] I started it as four hours a day, and it started to get more and more and now it's taking a lot of time. And suddenly both jobs have more requirements that I'm trying to fulfill Second job a Company in the US called (name of job). It helps college students finish their degrees faster.
Provides - I'm an online Program Manager now. It gives a lot of new insights and new ways of doing things. It's all over the world it's an online company. So we have people form India, columbia honduras usa. It feels good to interact with so many people from different places. They document every single thing they do in a clear way into SOPs - everything is documented in a clear way so if anyone leaves someone else can take their place We're bringing that learning into KidsCan so we can have more freedom, it'll be easier to hire people and keep the same quality.
Emotionally, I want to do (Name of project) at the end since it's crazy here in Lebanon, you have to be financial stable at some point. I learned my skills by volunteering with lot of projects before. With (Name of project), you need to learn with all the challenges that can come up and have a solution for every problem. In (Name of project) there's a project that needs to happen you get the PM experience where you can imagine the steps to take, the challenges, things to think about, budget, time limit, skills of people on the team, etc. [[Code: Empowerment-Through-Learning]] [[Code: Security]] [[Code: Backup-plans]]
Do you live with your family?
Can you tell me about your history with entrepreneurship?
It didn't come from my family. Especially that I live in a rural area. They can be afraid of new ideas.  They tell us to get a job with a regular company. I take trainings with companies here and I learn a lot abou thow to do things. partner1 and partner2, a strong support system. That played a major role in us taking the risk together. (What makes you partner2/partner1 different) - I need to improve every single day, that idea makes me want to do KidsCan, take the second job. I believe it's the same idea that made me to KidsCan that made me find another job to find another. (why not get a real job)
This is psychology. It's from a past experience - It's made me feel like I am not good enough, so I wanted to always push myself out of my comfort zone. I need to keep going up. I don't know if that's what makes me different, the way I think. Maybe I learned french and english and I got the ability to explroe those cultures. When you explore those cultures you get new ideas than the culture you live with. Get out of the small circle that I grew up with.
(How did you develop those ideas? )
It's complicated, it has a lot of stories and elements to it. I have this belief, if you want to live your life really well, be as honest as posisble. You'll know the truth, you're not having a fake experience. First it is something that has to do with my surroundings. I've seen peopel sruggle with the simplest things and they didn't kno whow to react to them. they didn't have enough knowledge. And I didn't have enough skill to transform these ideas with enough skill without being resisted without sounding different and arrogant. And it was a love story, the other part of it. That thing hit deep... I was so young, I didn't know anything about anything. The guy I fell in love with knew a lot of thigns I didn't know. The way he left I didnt' understand why that happened. I switched all of that thing to one goal... Get better. I don't know if that's completely right. I want to help people around me, I want to help people not struggle anymore. The second part, was whoa, he left you... why? I don't understand it myself. At the level of honesty where the level of honesty. [[Code: Value-Self knowledge]] [[Code: Silver-Linings]] [[Code: Loss]]
Do you have a therepist and councelor?
No, I ask myself these questions myself, and my friends. I have these questions where I want to let it out there
Can you tell me about your decision making process when you decided to start your own business?
It's weird, I never thought about this. I think we had the idea in mind before. I had the idea when I was in college, let's go back and do that (we finished college in Beirut and we went back to our town hasbeiyyah) We came back and noticed there are not a lot of opportunities to get a regular job. And we were in that training (entrepreneurship training, Hasbeiyyh AMIDEAST), it felt super right. There were two cohorts one in Beirut, where we knew about it and then we went to Hasbiyyah and atteneded the training there. It felt right and we didnt' think much about it at the moment. It wasnt' absed on a decision making process. It was an idea and we had a passion and we attempted to do it. It wasn't based on discussions on possible alternatives a good plan for the future. What if someone gets married and moves out. What are the plans? I think that was a mistake? We should have planned it in more depth than just jumping in. [[Code: Feeling-Joy]] [[Code: Strategic]]
The challenge .... is me, I got another job. I'm not giivng 100% to projectName like person1 and person2 are doing. Is it ok for me to not give 100% to projectName, did I break the agreement? (talking about it now?) Yes, there are meetings that are happening and ... I don't know. It's something that I don't want to lose their trust I don't want to make them feel that I'm not entirely committed, maybe I'm not entirely committed... the reason - things are tough and i need to get my life together. I'm trying to be as honest as possible and I'm attempting to let them be open to sharing too. I want to fight with them. Tell me! What's going on, how are you thinking about me, Tell me? We met last thursday, and I'm trying to meet with them. (why did the not look for other work?) - perhaps they didn't have the opportunity, or they [[Code: Value-Trust]]
1

Where were you when the blast happened
I was at home, really far away from the place
Prior experience?
[[Experience_Prior_Violence_True]] It was the war between Israel and Lebanon in 2006. I was young. For some reason, my parents did not allow us to be scared. I don't remember being so scared. I just felt safe with my family. (how did they help you not be scared) They never seemed scared to me, they always made me feel like I'm safe, I was a kid and I never felt like something bad is going to happen. It was a war and people's houses were being bombed and as a kid I felt safe because of my parents. [[Code: Safety]]
What are your first memories of what happened then?
It was actually Dara, she texted on the group, "guys are you ok." I was like what's going on, and I went to social media to find out. It was a huge shock. Like not being able to imagine. what are the things that could have actualyl happened there. At first they don't show you anything. You just see videos of things blowing up and it was a shock and it was scary since you don't knjow how bad it affected people there.
How were you affected by the blast?
Definitely you feel like - I rememeber saying that it feels like it happened inside of my house. This is my city, I lived there for years. And yeah... (pause) [[Code: Feeling-Sad]]
Did you know people affected by the blast directly?
Not exactly, I know aquaintances. I know people who were injured, although it didnt' affect my friends/family members.
What are some of the changes in your life since the August 4th blast?
It's made me not in the daily review. It changed some ideas that I have. About the leadership of this country. And it's made me more convinced that we should keep on with the revolution and do everything possible to have that new people leading the country, ebcause it's ridiculous that a huge amount of that explosive material is just out there. That's not something you'd do inside your house, you wouldn't put something that would blast your house and keep it there without thinking about it. what are these people doing, what? did they not know? [[Code: Response-Political change]][[Code: Political Anger]]
How did the blast affect your thinking/thinking about your projects?
Politically. Not in the daily life, but my thinking
Yeah, definitely. We integrated it with the kids. We did a session that talked about Lebanon, their vision and their blast. We wanted to hear their thoughts and how it affected them. We thought about future sessions abou thtis, about lebabnon, express their feelings abou thteir country. their expectations, we actualyl posted that one of the girls came up and mentioned if i was president I would have build the houses of the people that were affected for free. It was beautiful to see that young girl thinking in that way, better than the leader of this country. [[Code: Ideation-Revolutionary]]
Any reminder brought back feelings about it
When the blast happened. This cloud appeared, orange cloud. Whenever I see this organge cloud again, even if it's not from the blast, I remember the blast. (when do you see orange clouds like that) the color, I remember that color and whenever the color comes out.
I had trouble staying asleep
The night of the blast - I remember I was crying and I called a friend and we cried together. That was the only night that I couldn't sleep.
I avoided letting myself get upset when I thought about it or was reminded of it
Oh, zero! I try not to suppress any feelings. [[Code: Feeling-Acceptance]]
I felt as if it hadn't happened or wasn't real
I digested that, I came to realize that and came to realize what are the negative effects from that.
I was jumpy and easily startled (surprised)
Basically because I didn't hear the blast. I wasn't there.
I tried not to think about it
If the idea came to my mind I don't actively supress the idea. (how did you wind up doing this?) - I believe to make peace with the things that are happening and to digest them really well, you need to accept your feelings and you need to allow yourself to feel and think very clearly. So supressing things mean you're not dealing with it, keeping it hidden. Once you think about things and be as honest as possible with yourself, you allow that healing process to begin. This is a theory I developed and try to apply it and I think it's working. Some of the things.... i made peace with ym first love experience, I faced it all id' say...  [[Code: Feeling-Acceptance]] [[Code: Feeling-Confidence]]
I was aware that I still had a lot of feelings about it, but I didn't deal with them
I had feelings and dealt with them
My feelings about it were kind of numb (empty, neutral)
It hurt to see your capital city destroyed because the people in charge didn't pay attention to something like that. The amoutn of damage could have been avoided if those people were doing their job right, it's frustrating to have those poeple be the leaders of your country when you're thoughts are to make your country better to impact your community, we want to make the country better with kidscan impact parents and children. This shows the leaders don't want the country to be better, it's the oppositte. The feeling doesn't hurt anymore as it was in the beginning, it's a reality I understood.  [[Code: Political Anger]]
[[Resilience BRCS]]
BRCS_Score: 13
How have you been coping after the blast?
[[Post Traumatic Growth Index]]
PTGI_Score: 71
PTGI_Average: 3.380

I changed my priorities about what is important in life.
I don't think I changed priorities because of the blast, I did change priorities. I want to focus more about me and not my job. My personal life. (what helped inspire the reprioritization) - when I took two jobs I was in so much pressure it made me stop and think, what am  i doing. Is work worth all of that effor tand it made me think of the other aspects that I've not been taking care of so much. So yeah, it's related to the bnlast somehow, because of the blast I took the second job.... and... [[Code: Reprioritization]]
I developed new interests.
I started reading more. It was because of a person who reads a lot - inspired me to start reading.
I have a greater feeling of self-reliance.
In response to the blast, because when I had the job online I felt I challenged the situation in Lebanon and made something happen for me in response to the bad situation here.
I established a new path for my life.
I'm trying
I am more willing to express my emotions.
I'm always willing to express my emotions
I know better that I can handle difficulties.
It goes back to when a difficult situation happens and you deal with it, you feel that you can deal with the same thing again because you've understood the process. You feel more resilient. (is this happening in Lebanon now) I can't say yes/no because it depends on how each individual thinks [[Code: Response-Resilience]]
New opportunities are available which wouldn't have been otherwise.
If it didn't happen, better opportunities for he people in Lebanon are going to happen. And again, the way I reacted to that was I went out and got an online job which will pay me. Opportunity that I wouldn't have thought about it. Not sure it's the case for all people who don't speak english fluenty and can have the same opportunity. 5 for me, 3/2 for people in Lebanon [[Code: Silver-Linings]]
I put more effort into my relationships.
What changed? When I worked all the time some of my relationships were affected. especially with partner1/partner2 and I think I took that for granted, and forgot how important they are and I understand they are more important than any job, individualll and even if i want to view (project name) as a job, they are more important than (projectname) [[Code: Social-Support]]
I am more likely to try to change things which need changing.
If I can change them, absolutely. If I cannot, I wont try. This is something I had to learn, is there something I can do right now that cna make the situation better. If I know the exact process, then yeah, and if I only have theories I wont attempt that anymore. It goes back to when I thought I could help people change their mind, I realize now everyone has their own thinking process. [[Code: Value-Agency]]
I have a stronger religious faith.
I always try to read more and devleop that.
I discovered that I'm stronger than I thought I was.
I feel like I taught myself to be stronger. It's not a fact that you're strong/not strong, you need to work on that. It's not something that doesn't change. It's about teaching yourself and to be flexible and adjust faster.
I learned a great deal about how wonderful people are.
It's for partner1/partner2, yeah. :D
I better accept needing others.
It's weird that I asnwered people are reliable lower than accept needing others. Because I can rely on others, and at the same time I have that thing I can count on my self alone. it's something I can trust others, I can have healthy relationships with others, but if that person went away, I taught myself how to function on my own. (do you think you can function without your family) - yeah - I can :) sadly - It's sad that I feel that, I feel like life makes you think/ pushes you to ... I've been through some situations where I pushed myself where I should count on myself 100% - It's sad to say, but I believe I can. [[Code: Value-Independence]]

I don't think I forced myself, sit down and think about the problem and how to deal with that. When my emotions came up I thought about how to deal with them

My friends, myself. I've been helping myself. [[Code: Value-True friends]]

A lot to play, by entrepreneurship or something else, social work, or getting new ideas. When I took the online job, I convinced 5 other people to join the online job and now we're five. Affect community, move economy. Apply ideas to create change in the community. [[Code: Silver-Linings]]

messages.content:
Here are 10 questions to better understand the interviews and identify common themes related to factors connecting to post-traumatic growth:

Questions I can answer based on the information provided:

1. Several interviewees mentioned the importance of social support, whether from family, friends, or colleagues, in coping with the aftermath of the blast. How prevalent was this theme across all the interviews?

2. Many participants discussed their entrepreneurial drive and desire to make a positive impact in Lebanon despite the challenges. Did this sense of purpose and agency seem to contribute to their resilience and growth?

3. Some interviewees reported experiencing anger, frustration, and a desire for political change following the blast. Was this a common reaction, and did it appear to motivate any specific actions or decisions?

4. A few participants mentioned the role of spirituality or religion in their coping and meaning-making process. Was this a significant theme, and did it seem to relate to their experience of growth?

5. Several interviewees discussed the importance of self-awareness, self-care, and personal development in navigating challenges. Did this focus on personal growth and self-improvement appear to be a common factor in their stories of resilience?

Questions only you can answer:

6. In your perspective as the interviewer, which personal qualities or characteristics stood out as most strongly associated with participants' ability to cope, adapt, and grow in the face of adversity?

7. Based on your in-depth knowledge of each interviewee's story, did you notice any patterns or differences in the experiences and responses of those who were directly impacted by the blast versus those who were indirectly affected?

8. As you conducted these interviews, were there any specific moments or turning points that seemed to be particularly pivotal in participants' journeys of post-traumatic growth?

9. Reflecting on your interactions with the interviewees, did you perceive any notable differences in the ways that men and women, or people of different ages or backgrounds, described their experiences and coping strategies?

10. Drawing on your expertise in this field and your familiarity with the broader context in Lebanon, how do you see the unique challenges and opportunities faced by entrepreneurs in this setting shaping their potential for resilience and growth?

3. Some interviewees reported experiencing anger, frustration, and a desire for political change following the blast. Was this a common reaction, and did it appear to motivate any specific actions or decisions?
